channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. inflation report shows 2.4% increase in consumer prices
item.description: U.S. inflation picked up a bit last month as food costs rose , though overall inflation remained mostly tame. Consumer prices increased 2.4% in May co...

item.title: What the L.A. Protests Mean for Small Businesses and the Economy
item.description: An expert on American labor history lays out what needs to happen to avoid a recession as the government pushes for mass deportations.

item.title: What to Say to Employees Who Take More Than Their Share of Free Food
item.description: Some employees take so much food at company events that none is left for clients. Here’s how to handle it.

item.title: How Keurig Dr Pepper CEO Tim Cofer secured one of the biggest coups of his career, a $1.65 billion deal for an energy drink giant
item.description: Cofer had his eye on GHOST—but had to convince co-founder Dan Lourenco to sell.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s Best Advice on How to Be Successful? Science Says He’s Right
item.description: According to Buffett, birds of a feather should want to flock together.

item.description: Of course, I don’t mean to say McDonald’s is going away …

item.title: How overconfidence can kill a COO’s shot at the corner office
item.description: For ambitious COOs, the lesson is clear: respect the current power structure, and stay tightly synced with the CEO.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg’s superintelligence gamble: Can billions and bold hires save Meta’s AI ambitions?

item.title: Exclusive: Outdoor Voices founder Ty Haney raises $11 million for her second startup
